channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Grass, 23rd December
item.description:
Every weekend the christ Church has a gathering and lots of cars park on the grass opposite side of church highlighted in pink markers, and on pavements for a lkng while now, as in photo look at the damage caused. there needs to be traffic enforcement officers there on Sundays as parked on pavements marked with double yellows, and bollards put in place. this is every sunday. the church management are responsible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cross Street, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti in Sutton Walk along the pedestrian access from Waterloo Station to the South Bank.n, 23rd December
item.description:
Now that the pedestrian route from the South Bank ie. Belvedere Road towards Waterloo Station has been improved, (in spite of the undersized litter bins), are you planning to replace the random graffiti along Sutton Walk with a permanent artistic mural? This would present both a positive, less threatening impression to visitors to Central London and a meaningful connection to the South Bank centre. Graffiti scribblers usually respect decent art. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Mepham Street, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More Graffiti, 23rd December
item.description:
Graffiti in place as Hackney have put up scaffolding and not done any work. More graffiti over the weekend. Please remove graffiti and then the scaffolding. A police presence is needed.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London

item.title: South Croxted Road SE21 opposite side of the road to house number 187 / 189 gr, 23rd December
item.description:
South Croxted Road SE21 opposite side of the road to house number 187 / 189 green painted wooden fence extensively graffiti tagged – large tin of painted needed. (Numbers 187 & 189 on Lambeth side but as this opposite side comes under you ie Southwark.)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 185,187, South Croxted Road, Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Horse poo on the pavement at the triangular junction opposite the Bear and Ragged Staff pub, 23rd December
item.description:
A large amount of horse poo on the footpath at the crossing opposite the Bear and Ragged Staff pub. It has been there for at least one day and has been trodden in by people, prams etc.
